titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller Brothers Fund records, President, William M. Dietel papers, RG 2, Series 1
A Guide to the Rockefeller Brothers Fund records, President, William M. Dietel papers, RG 2, Series 1 FA774

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-09-02 19:51:55 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Brothers Fund records, President, William M. Dietel papers, RG 2, Series 1

physdesc.extent: 69 document boxes and 1 record storage box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted.

Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: William M. Dietel served as the fifth President of the Rockefeller Brothers Fund, succeeding Dana S. Creel in 1975, and serving through 1987.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: RBF donated the collection to RAC in 2012. The Dietel papers were transferred to RAC beginning in 1988.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Dietel papers primarily contain correspondence, reports, program planning and evaluation materials and Board of Directors/Board of Trustees records documenting his tenure as RBF President, as well as other professional memberships, positions, organizations and activities he was concurrently involved with. The collection also contains a small selection of personal and semi-personal correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: RAC has legal title to the records. Copyright and literary rights to the collection remains with RBF in so far as it holds them. RAC may grant permission to publish.
